content: <@!543900561460822016> <@!153709109122826240> and I will be working here on getting mev-boost milestone 1 tested with mergemock

author: lightclient
content: What is the argument for CL calling a builder with `engine_forkChoiceUpdated` vs. something like `builder_preparePayload` that just includes the required attributes and head hash to build on?

author: ranisis
content: no particular reason, it's a vestige of how mev-boost used to be a middleware

author: ranisis
content: I think the argument for keeping it is that the relay will have to inevitably do the same operations that an execution client would

author: lightclient
content: Shouldn’t a relay be running their own CL though?

author: ranisis
content: hmm true, it will be running both an execution and consensus client

author: ranisis
content: if we go further down this road, I'd almost prefer to do away with the `preparePayload` call completely, since it actually adds little value to the relay

author: lightclient
content: Right, so maybe it makes sense to have a single method `getPayload` that’s takes a block hash as a parameter and then relay returns a header built on top of that block?

author: ranisis
content: the eventual plan is that relays should be building blocks pre-emptively across many likely block head states, so it should be ready to reply with a header almost immediately in any case
